segment.documentation: BGM, A segment by which the sender must uniquely identify the Instruction for Returns.

DTM, A segment specifying the dates, and when relevant, the times related to the whole message, e.g. pick up date, message date. The segment must be specified at least once to specify the message date as allocated by the sender.

FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.
CUX, A segment to specify currencies and relevant details for the rate of exchange.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments by which the sender of the message indicates to the receiver what type of document or message will accompany or follow the instruction for returns message, e.g., a credit note.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment by which the sender of the message indicates to the receiver what type of document or message will accompany or follow (e.g. credit note) the instruction for returns message.
DTM, A segment specifying the date and where necessary the time related to the current document. This may be used to indicate required document receipt dates, times, or periods.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments providing references and any associated dates related to the current message, e.g. announcement for returns number, invoice, etc.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for providing references related to the whole instruction for returns message.
DTM, A segment specifying the date and where necessary the time of the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments identifying the parties involved in the instruction to return message and any associated information.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify a party name and address, either by coded identification or in clear form. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party identification should be specified, e.g. the Buyer and Seller are known to each other, thus only the coded identification is required.
LOC, A segment to allow the identification of locations related to the current party, e.g. the location of the goods for returns.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments for specifying any references relating to the current party.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for the inclusion of any references related to the current party.
DTM, A segment specifying the date and where necessary the time of the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments identifying the contact person or department for the current party and if required specifying the communication channel and number.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department and their function, to whom communications should be directed.
COM, A segment specifying the communication channel and number for the specified contact.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments identifying any states, instructions, dates or additional references related to the complete instruction for return message.

segment.documentation: CDI, A segment to enable return states to be specified.
INP, A segment to enable return instructions to be specified.
DTM, A segment specifying the date and or time related to the return state.

FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments for specifying any references, and if required any dates, related to the and conditions.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for the inclusion of any references related to the conditions.
DTM, A segment specifying the date and where necessary the time of the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments indicating the terms of delivery for the whole instruction for returns.

segment.documentation: TOD, A segment identifying the delivery terms used, e.g. INCOTERMS, a code could be used to specify the delivery terms.
LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the delivery terms.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments identifying the mode and means of transport, location and relevant dates and times for transportation, relating to the whole instruction for returns.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the mode, means and identification of the transport for the goods on which instructions for returns are being provided.
LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the transport details.
DTM, A segment identifying any dates associated with the transport details.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments to specify equipment in which goods will be transported.

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to specify equipment, equipment size and type used in the transport.
MEA, A segment to specify measurements associated with the equipment, such as size.
FTX, A segment to specify processable supplementary information associated with the equipment. 4.1.2 Detail section Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: SG13-SG14-SG15-SG16-SG18-SG20-SG21 A group of segments providing details of the individual items for which instruction for returns are being provided. There must be at least one occurrence of this group within an instruction for returns.

segment.documentation: LIN, A segment identifying a line item by the line item number and configuration level, and additionally, identifying the product for return. Other product identification numbers, e.g. supplier product number etc., can be specified within the following PIA segment.
PIA, A segment providing additional identification to the product specified in the LIN segment (e.g. Harmonized System number).
IMD, A segment for describing the current line item as well as product characteristic. This segment should be used for products that cannot be fully identified by an article number.
MEA, A segment enabling the physical measurements of the current item to be specified where this is required for full identification of the product.
DTM, A segment specifying date and or time, or period details relating to the current line item only, e.g. collection date.
QTY, A segment identifying the product quantities, e.g. return quantity.

FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.
LOC, A segment to allow the further identification of locations related to the current line item.
MOA, A segment specifying any monetary amounts relating to the product, e.g. credit note amount.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments by which the sender of the message indicates to the receiver what type of document or message will accompany or follow the instruction for returns message, e.g., a credit note, for the current line item.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment by which the sender of the message indicates to the receiver what type of document or message will accompany or follow the return (e.g. credit note) for the current line item.
DTM, A segment specifying the date and where necessary the time related to the document. This may be used to indicate required document receipt dates, times, or periods.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments for specifying any references relating to the current line item only, e.g. invoice number, etc.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for the inclusion of any references related to the current line item.
DTM, A segment specifying the date and where necessary the time of the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments giving information about dangerous goods.

segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to indicate the class of dangerous goods.
QTY, A segment to specify quantity of the given dangerous goods.
FTX, A segment to describe dangerous goods.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments identifying handling instructions relevant to the current line item only.

segment.documentation: HAN, A segment providing information on required handling and notification of hazardous materials relevant to the current line item only.

FTX, A segment with free text information relevant to the handling instructions, in coded or clear form, used when additional handling information is needed. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments identifying packaging, marks and numbers, date and time information about packing for the product for which an instruction for returns is provided.

segment.documentation: PAC, A segment specifying the number and type of the packages/physical units and the physical type of packaging for the current line item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments specifying markings, labels, and packing numbers.

segment.documentation: PCI, A segment specifying markings and or labels used on the package described in the PAC segment.
DTM, A segment for specifying date and or time, or period related to the package.
GIN, A segment providing the identity numbers related to the current package.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments identifying any states, instructions, dates or additional references related to the return of the current line item.

segment.documentation: CDI, A segment to enable return states to be specified.
INP, A segment to enable return instructions to be specified.
DTM, A segment specifying the date and or time related to the return state.

FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segments for specifying any references, and if required any dates, related to the states for the current line item.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for the inclusion of any references related to the conditions.
DTM, A segment specifying the date and where necessary the time of the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments identifying the mode and means of transport, location and relevant dates and times for transportation, relating to the current line item.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the mode, means and identification of the transport for the current line item.
LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the transport, e.g. place of collection.
DTM, A segment identifying any dates associated with the transport details.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 21: A group of segments to specify equipment related to the transport of the current line item.

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to specify equipment, equipment size and type used in the transport.
MEA, A segment to specify measurements, other than dimensions, associated with the equipment, such as weight.
FTX, A segment to specify processable supplementary information associated with the equipment. 4.1.3 Summary section Information to be provided in the Summary section:
CNT, A segment by which control totals may be provided by the sender for checking by the receiver.
